metadata.title: CVE-2020-14347 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way xserver memory was not properly initialized.This could leak parts of server memory to the X client. In cases where Xorgserver runs with elevated privileges, this could result in possible ASLRbypass. Xorg-server before version 1.20.9 is vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
